alert.note: Alert for Fleming (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 29 at 9:36PM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Fleming County through 1015 PM EST... At 935 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Carlisle, or 13 miles northwest of Mount Sterling, moving northeast at 65 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Fairview and Cowan around 950 PM EST. Craintown, Elizaville, Pecks Ridge, Nepton and Tilton around 955 PM EST. Other locations in the path of this storm include Flemingsburg, Mount Carmel and Foxport. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
